title: 7 Oct: Mass Arbitrary Arrests in Malls and Residential Area

replies.msg:
Journalist Being Pushed by Riot Police when Conducting News Livestream

2140 Ma On Shan
Riot police rushed into MOSTown and arrested a citizen.

Journalist from Stand News was pushed by the riot police while attempting to report the scene. The riot police removed her glasses and aimed pepper spray at her.

Source: Stand News
https://m.facebook.com/story.php?story_fbid=10157967496275016&id=27743445015

(cont.)

Securities attempted to block the door of MOSTown, a shopping mall in Ma On Shan, as riot police forced their way into the mall.

After entering the mall by force, the riot police atrested at least a person and pushed a journalist. Onlookers screamed at the chaotic scene.

Police Entered Private Property to Make Arrest

In Taikoo, residents of Kornhill Garden fled to the podium as the police began arresting onlookers. The security guard of the housing estate, however, did not stop the police from entering the private property. A resident without a mask was subsequently arrested.

Other residents gathered around the security guard and requested for a legitimate explanation. The residents were notified earlier that a searching warrant is required before the police are allowed to enter the private property to make arrest.

Source: United Social Press

Face-Covering Police Inflicted Verbal Sexual Harrassment on Female Pedestrians

Watch the video.
In the video, face-covering police were heckling female pedestrians with flashlights, swear words and name calling, 'You Aids Angels, nobody would want you!'*

Later on, the masked police waved their batons and intimidated the onlookers by rushing towards them.

*referring to the fake rumors previously spread by government official Fanny Law, where she accused female [protesters] of being tricked into providing "free sex" (in Law's words) to frontliners and being hailed as "angels" (in Law's words).

Source: https://www.facebook.com/1635707343349674/posts/2432989076954826/

Taikoo, Ma On Shan and Tsing Yi Among Others: Police Trepassing Private Properties across Districts

At around 23: 27 in Tsing Yi, the riot police attempted to enter Tivoli Garden, a residential area in Tsing Yi, to conduct search. They argued with the security guard of the housing estate.

Can the Hong Kong Police Do Whatever They Want Now?

In Tai Po, a police van kept turning around in circle at the crossroads, in total disregard of road traffic regulation and pedestrians' safety.

Source: https://www.facebook.com/FinanceFellow/videos/454763745140383/

Police fired tear gas towards hotel and residences for no apparent reason

At around 22:17 in Tseung Kwan O, police fired tear gas towards Beverley Garden and then fired another round towards a nearby hotel for no apparent reason.

Source: Now News




After Swearing at Journalists, Police Accused them of Inventing Stories

2213 Mong Kok Hamilton Street / Nathan Road
Police warned journalists not to do anything 'unnecessary,' "Police are doing their job, you don't need to teach us!", "Leave, You Freedom C*nt" and told onlookers not to provoke the police. The onlookers responded, "No one is provoking you if you would just leave."

Later, the police denied saying above words and claimed that journalists were making up stories. The police also told the journalists to switch off their lighting equipments.

Source: Real Time News Broadcast
English translation from Telegram Channel: Guardians of Hong Kong
